qas.question: How much of consumed electricity does Estonia produce by itself?
What percentage of electricity was produced with local oil shale in 2011?
What alternative energy sources account for 9% of energy production?
What percentage of electricity was produced from renewable energy in 2009?

context: Estonia produces about <a0_0>75%<a0_0/> of its consumed electricity. In 2011 <a1_0>about 85%<a1_0/> of it was generated with locally mined oil shale. Alternative energy sources such as <a2_0>wood, peat, and biomass<a2_0/> make up approximately 9% of primary energy production. Renewable wind energy was about <a3_0>6%<a3_0/> of total consumption in 2009. Estonia imports petroleum products from western Europe and Russia. Oil shale energy, telecommunications, textiles, chemical products, banking, services, food and fishing, timber, shipbuilding, electronics, and transportation are key sectors of the economy. The ice-free port of Muuga, near Tallinn, is a modern facility featuring good transshipment capability, a high-capacity grain elevator, chill/frozen storage, and new oil tanker off-loading capabilities.[citation needed] The railroad serves as a conduit between the West, Russia, and other points to the East.[citation needed]
